alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 8:31PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Albany, northwestern Platte and southeastern Converse Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 831 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Sibley Peak, or 25 miles northwest of Wheatland, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Albany, northwestern Platte and southeastern Converse Counties. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 101 and 104. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; North Laramie Range
